state.phase: Initial build complete — deployed to Vercel
state.summary: Built complete Next.js website for Paragon Pool & Spa from scratch. 8 pages + 404 + API route, real business data from web research (owner Mike Henry, 3 locations, BBB A+, real testimonials, verified brand partnerships). SEO foundation with JSON-LD, sitemap, robots.txt, llms.txt. CRM integration via contact form + n8n webhook. 23 tests passing. Deployed to Vercel at paragon-pools.vercel.app. GitHub repo at vbonk/paragon-pools.
nextActions: Configure N8N_WEBHOOK_URL env var on Vercel for CRM routing
Run Lighthouse audit on deployed site for baseline comparison report
Create docs/audit/original-site-audit.md comparing Wix vs new site

keyDecisions: Content-data separation: all page content in typed TS files under src/content/, components are data-agnostic
n8n webhook-first CRM: decouples website from CRM choice (can swap Odoo/GHL/custom without code changes)
3 real locations from research: Willernie (primary), Stillwater, Forest Lake — corrected from placeholder data
No images yet: deployed text-only to get foundation live fast, images are next phase
Reused AtriaREG patterns: rate limiter, honeypot, Zod validation, fire-and-forget webhook
warnings: N8N_WEBHOOK_URL not yet configured on Vercel — contact form submits succeed but webhook is no-op
All testimonials are real quotes from their website but attributed generically (no last names available)
criticalInfo: Legal name is 'Paragon Pool and Patio, Inc.' not 'Paragon Pool and Spa'
Owner: Mike Henry, President (founded 1990, in industry since 1970s)

continuePrompt: Add real images, configure N8N_WEBHOOK_URL on Vercel, set up custom domain, run Lighthouse comparison audit
